FuncDef: The reset dhcp chasten-user command clears information about limited DHCP user connections.
CLIs: reset dhcp chasten-user slot <slotid> [ mac-address <mac-address> [ interface { <interface-type> <interface-num> | <interface-name> } [ pe-vlan <pe-vlan> [ ce-vlan <ce-vlan> ] ] ] ] [ statistics ]

ParaDef.Info:
Clears information about limited DHCP user connections with a specified MAC address.
The value is in H-H-H format, where H can be one to four hexadecimal digits. It cannot be a broadcast or multicast MAC address.

Clears information about limited DHCP user connections with a specified interface.
-

Clears information about limited DHCP user connections with a specified interface.
-

Clears information about limited DHCP user connections with a specified outer VLAN ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Clears information about limited DHCP user connections with a specified inner VLAN ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Clears statistics about limited DHCP user connections.
-

Clears information about limited DHCP user connections on a specified board.
-

ExtraInfo:
If statistics is not specified in the reset dhcp chasten-user command, the command clears a user's suppression entries on a specified board. After the command is run, the system stops suppressing the user. If statistics is specified in the reset dhcp chasten-user command, the command clears statistics about limited DHCP user connections. After the command is run, statistics are cleared but the system does not stop suppressing the user.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
